notes: Cobb-Douglas cars year+mfr FE clustered by mfr (Table 2 Col 3). lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.029 p<0.001 N=14423 R2=0.879.
Adds turbo+super dummies to baseline Cobb-Douglas. lcurbwt=-0.383. Tests sensitivity to including engine aspiration controls.
Year FE only (drops mfr FE). lcurbwt=-0.398. Tests sensitivity to removing manufacturer fixed effects.

Translog specification. lcurbwt linear term=-0.043 p=0.97. NOT COMPARABLE: total elasticity requires evaluation at sample means using squared/interaction terms. Linear coefficient is meaningless in isolation.
Translog with turbo+super. lcurbwt linear term=0.197 p=0.88. NOT COMPARABLE: same issue as translog -- linear coefficient not interpretable without squared/interaction terms.
Translog year FE only. lcurbwt linear term=0.462 p=0.72. NOT COMPARABLE: translog linear coefficient not interpretable in isolation.
Drops torque from baseline. lcurbwt=-0.444. Tests sensitivity to omitting torque control.
Weight only (no HP or torque). lcurbwt=-0.892. Omitted variable bias inflates weight coefficient as it absorbs HP/torque effects.
Drops HP from baseline. lcurbwt=-0.428. Tests sensitivity to omitting horsepower control.
Pooled OLS no FE. lcurbwt=-0.413. Tests sensitivity to removing all fixed effects.
Mfr FE only (no year FE). lcurbwt=-0.455. Tests sensitivity to removing year fixed effects.
HC1 robust SE (no clustering). lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.010. Same coefficient; SE is 3x smaller without clustering.
Classical iid SE. lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.008. Same coefficient; SE is 4x smaller assuming iid errors.
Two-way clustering (mfr+year). lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.034. Same coefficient; SE slightly larger than baseline mfr clustering.
Clustered by year. lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.024. Same coefficient; SE slightly smaller than mfr clustering.
Trucks sample (d_truck==1). lcurbwt=-0.356. Tests whether weight elasticity holds for light trucks.
Full sample (cars+trucks) with truck dummy. lcurbwt=-0.388 N=26995. Tests pooled estimate across vehicle types.
Gasoline-only cars. lcurbwt=-0.428. Drops diesel vehicles; very close to baseline.
Includes outliers. lcurbwt=-0.395. Minimal sensitivity to outlier inclusion.
Early period 1980-1993. lcurbwt=-0.497. Larger elasticity in earlier decades.
Late period 1994-2006. lcurbwt=-0.280. Smaller elasticity in later decades suggesting trade-off weakened.
Excludes diesel vehicles. lcurbwt=-0.408. Very close to baseline.
Manual transmission only. lcurbwt=-0.499. Larger elasticity for manual cars.
Automatic transmission only. lcurbwt=-0.382. Slightly smaller elasticity for automatics.
Naturally aspirated only (no turbo/supercharger). lcurbwt=-0.387. Similar to baseline.
Only lcurbwt with year+mfr FE (no other regressors). lcurbwt=-0.894. Severe omitted variable bias.
Kitchen sink with all interactions. lcurbwt=0.197 p=0.88. DUPLICATE of translog_with_turbo_super (identical coefficient/SE/N). Not a meaningful separate spec.
Drops manual/time_d_manual controls. lcurbwt=-0.487. Some sensitivity to transmission controls.
Drops diesel dummy. lcurbwt=-0.330. Notable sensitivity to excluding diesel control.
Trucks with turbo+super dummies. lcurbwt=-0.355. Trucks sample with additional aspiration controls.
Trucks year FE only. lcurbwt=-0.363. Tests FE sensitivity for trucks.
Trucks translog. lcurbwt linear=1.391 p=0.27. NOT COMPARABLE: translog linear coefficient not interpretable.
Trucks translog with turbo+super. lcurbwt linear=1.431 p=0.23. NOT COMPARABLE: translog linear coefficient not interpretable.
Level MPG as DV. lcurbwt=-14.04. Different scale (level vs log) but same qualitative finding.
Log gallons per mile as DV. lcurbwt=+0.4186. Mechanically sign-flipped version of baseline (identical magnitude).
Level-level spec (mpg on weight hp torque). curbwt=-0.0064. Different coefficient name (level weight not log); same qualitative finding.
Semi-log (log mpg on level attributes). curbwt=-0.000199. Different scale (level weight); same qualitative sign.
Full sample with truck*attribute interactions. lcurbwt=-0.441 (cars-specific). Tests for differential truck effects.
Weight*diesel interaction. lcurbwt=-0.415. Tests whether weight elasticity differs for diesel vehicles.
Weight*manual interaction. lcurbwt=-0.359. Tests whether weight elasticity differs for manual transmission.
Trimmed 1% tails of lmpg. lcurbwt=-0.407. Minimal sensitivity to trimming.
Trimmed 5% tails of lmpg. lcurbwt=-0.379. Some attenuation with aggressive trimming.
Winsorized 1% lmpg. lcurbwt=-0.399. Minimal sensitivity to winsorization.
Drops 1980-1982. lcurbwt=-0.403. Robust to excluding earliest years.
Drops 2004-2006. lcurbwt=-0.455. Slightly larger without last 3 years.
1980-1986 window. lcurbwt=-0.494. Large elasticity in earliest window.
1985-1991 window. lcurbwt=-0.486. Large elasticity in mid-1980s window.
1990-1996 window. lcurbwt=-0.429. Close to full-sample baseline.
1995-2001 window. lcurbwt=-0.331. Smaller elasticity in late-1990s.
2000-2006 window. lcurbwt=-0.257. Smallest elasticity in most recent window.
Drops GMC. lcurbwt=-0.394. Tests sensitivity to dropping a major manufacturer.
Drops Chrysler. lcurbwt=-0.417. Very close to baseline.
Drops Ford. lcurbwt=-0.436. Very close to baseline.
Clustered by nameplate. lcurbwt=-0.4186 SE=0.022. Same coefficient; finer clustering than mfr.
WLS inverse mfr-year count weights. lcurbwt=-0.415. Near-identical to baseline OLS.
WLS inverse year count weights. lcurbwt=-0.417. Near-identical to baseline OLS.
CD + squared weight term. lcurbwt=-4.467. NOT COMPARABLE: linear coefficient not interpretable with quadratic term; total elasticity depends on evaluation point.
CD + squared HP term. lcurbwt=-0.390. Adding HP^2 barely changes weight coefficient.
CD + weight*HP interaction. lcurbwt=-1.135. NOT COMPARABLE: weight coefficient depends on HP evaluation point due to interaction.
Pooled OLS full sample with truck dummy no FE. lcurbwt=-0.370. Tests FE sensitivity on full sample.
Trucks gasoline only. lcurbwt=-0.383. Trucks subsample excluding diesel.
Trucks pooled OLS no FE. lcurbwt=-0.375. Tests FE sensitivity for trucks.
Trucks HC1 robust SE. lcurbwt=-0.356 SE=0.010. Same truck coefficient; much smaller SE without clustering.
Full sample translog with truck dummy. lcurbwt linear=0.723 p=0.33. NOT COMPARABLE: translog linear coefficient not interpretable.
Reports lhp coefficient (-0.262) instead of lcurbwt. Different estimand: HP elasticity not weight elasticity.
Reports lhp coefficient in translog (-2.937). Different estimand and translog linear term not interpretable.
Reports lhp coefficient for trucks (-0.071 p=0.097). Different estimand: HP elasticity for trucks.
1980s only. lcurbwt=-0.518. Largest decade-specific elasticity.
1990s only. lcurbwt=-0.403. Close to full-sample baseline.
2000s only. lcurbwt=-0.257. Smallest decade-specific elasticity. Identical to window_2000_2006.
Random effects on mfr. lcurbwt=+0.739. WRONG SIGN: Hausman-test-like result confirming FE is necessary. RE is inconsistent due to correlated unobserved heterogeneity.
CD + cubic weight term. lcurbwt=-76.53. NOT COMPARABLE: linear coefficient not interpretable with cubic term.
Uses log(HP/weight) instead of separate lhp. lcurbwt=-0.681. Constraining HP and weight to have proportional effects changes the weight elasticity meaningfully.
